folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & Grand Street., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Sixth Ave., east side, at Grand Street.
P. L. Sperr.
March 19, 1932.

(2)
The same, from a different angle, and at an earlier date.
P. L. Sperr.
October 18, 1928.

(3)
A more extensive view to show the apex of this triangular plot, formed by Thompson Street (right). Shown on the east side of the latter is the rear of St. Alphonsus R.C. Church.
P. L. Sperr.
August 3, 1937.
title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Grand Street.

folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & N. Canal Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)

Sixth Ave., east side, north from but not including Canal to and including Grand Streets. Note frame houses (No's 29 and 31 Grand Street) between Sixth Ave. and Thompson Street.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

(2)

The same, a further view. 1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - N. Canal Street - Grand Street

title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - N. Canal Street - Grand Street

folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & Grand & Canal Streets., Manhattan, NY
text:
Sixth Ave., east side, south from and including Grand, to and including Canal Streets. Also shown is Grand Street, south side, east from Sixth Ave., to and including Thompson Street. Nos. 29-31 Grand Street, adjoining and west of the S.W. corner of Thompson Street are frame houses. Also shown is the rear of St. Alphonsus Roman Catholic Church and School, through clearance for the widening of Sixth Ave.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York. Negative No. 307.
title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Grand - Canal Streets.
